title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A book that explores the history of the human species from the emergence of Homo sapiens to the present.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A novel set in a totalitarian society where women are oppressed and used for reproduction.

title: A Game of Thrones
author: George R.R. Martin
description: The first novel in the epic fantasy series A Song of Ice and Fire, set in the fictional continents of Westeros and Essos.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A novel about a young Andalusian shepherd named Santiago and his journey to find the meaning of life.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A novel set in Nazi Germany, narrated by Death, about a young girl who steals books and learns to read.

title: The Road Less Traveled
author: M. Scott Peck
description: A book that addresses various issues, such as love, growth, and spirituality.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller novel that follows the lives of three women linked by the disappearance of a person.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who stops speaking after being accused of murdering her husband.

title: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine
author: Gail Honeyman
description: A novel about a socially awkward woman who gradually opens up to the world around her.

title: Educated: A Memoir
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about the author's journey from a survivalist family in Idaho to becoming a scholar at Cambridge University.
